fields.headline: In brief
fields.bodyText: All-clear for China gets deals rolling Tour operators have been quick to respond to the lifting of the Foreign Office advice against travel to China, where the Sars virus has been brought under control. The last new case in Beijing was reported on May 29. Cox & Kings (020-7873 5000) is offering 15% off three trips to China in the autumn, which is the best time to travel. An eight-night China Experience trip now costs £1,526, saving £269. Ebookers reported this week that sales to Hong Kong have more than doubled since the threat of Sars was lifted. · The FO has revised its Travel Advice for Kenya, removing the warning issued May 15 against non-essential travel. For full details, visit fco.gov.uk/kenya or call 0870 6060290. FO advice on safety The Foreign Office has issued a new leaflet of advice for personal safety and information for victims of rape and sexual assault abroad, following a record number of cases reported to British consular staff overseas last year. The leaflet has advice on personal safety and how to find help after an assault. Elizabeth Lyall, of the Suzy Lamplugh Trust, which supports the initiative, said: "This needn't ruin people's holidays. They need to take the same safety precautions that they do at home. These assaults are not just being reported by young women. It is happening to men as well." Leaflets can be ordered by phoning 020-7008 0187 or emailing publicity.consular@gtnet.gov.uk. The guidelines can be found at fco.gov.uk.
